API¶

Atomic primitives¶

intptr_t atomic_faa(intptr_t * p, intptr_t inc)¶

Fetch and add

Parameters:
  • p – Pointer to data
  • inc – Increment to be added
Returns:

Original value at p
uintptr_t atomic_ll(uintptr_t * p)¶

Load linked

P:Pointer to data
Returns:0 on success
uintptr_t atomic_sc(uintptr_t * p, uintptr_t newval)¶

Store conditional

Parameters:
  • p – Pointer to data
  • newval – Value to store
Returns:

0 on success

Interrupt service routine¶

irq2vec(nirq)¶

Convert an IRQ number to an exception vector number

vec2irq(nvec)¶

Convert an exception vector number to an IRQ number

int register_isr(const int lvec, void (*)(const int) handler)¶

Register an ISR.

Parameters:
  • lvec – Logical vector number
  • handler – Function pointer to a constructor
Returns:

Logical vector number on success or negative value in case of failure, refer to errno.h
int register_isr_register(const int nvec, int (*)(const int, void (*)(const int)) f, const _Bool force)¶

Register a constructor of secondary ISRs. A secondary ISR gets registered by a constructor that is registered prior using this function.

Parameters:
  • nvec – Vector number. nvec is not an IRQ number but an exception number
  • f – Function pointer to a constructor
  • force – Force to register if true
Returns:

0 on success
int unregister_isr(const int lvec)¶

Unregister ISR

Parameters:
  • lvec – Logical vector number
Returns:

0 on success or refer to errno.h
void nvic_set(const int nvec, const _Bool on)¶

Enable or disable nvic interrupts

Parameters:
  • nvec – Vector number. nvec is not an IRQ number but an exception number
  • on – true for enabling, false for disabling
void nvic_set_pri(const int nvec, const int pri)¶

Set interrupt priority

Parameters:
  • nvec – Vector number. nvec is not an IRQ number but an exception number
  • pri – Priority, from IRQ_PRIORITY_LOWEST to IRQ_PRIORITY_HIGHEST
